document.docAuthor: Frankenberg, Sarah, Knyshov, Alexander, Hoey-Chamberlain, Rochelle & Weirauch, Christiane
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic revision of Guapinannus Wygodzinsky, 1951 (Hemiptera: Schizopteridae), with description of 19 new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Measurements are based on male specimens, except for
G. minutus ,
sp. n. ,
G. dispar
,
sp. n.
and
Guapinannus bierigi Wygodzinsky
where only female specimens are known.

paragraph.keyLead:
2 scc on forewing divided by sinuous, transverse vein ( Fig. 2 )..............................
Guapinannus dispar ,
sp. n.

- scc on forewing without sinuous, transverse vein.......................................
Guapinannus tergus ,
sp. n.

4 Scutellum with tip slightly inflated ( Fig. 3 ,
G. minutus
,
sp. n.
).................................................. 5

5 Body length ~ 1.1 mm , proximal part of Cu well-defined................................
Guapinannus minutus ,
sp. n.

- Body length ~ 1.5 mm , proximal part of Cu not well defined............................
Guapinannus tatumbia ,
sp. n.

6 Part of An1 and Cu forming posterodistal margin of tc more pronounced than other veins ( Fig. 2 ,
G. falcis
,
sp. n.
)........ 7
- Part of An1 and Cu forming posterodistal margin of tc similar to other veins....................................... 8

7 cub close to wing margin ( Fig. 2 ,
G. falcis
,
sp. n.
).......................................
Guapinannus falcis
,
sp. n.

- cub removed from wing margin ( Fig. 1B ).......................................
Guapinannus bierigi Wygodzinsky

8 Anophoric process of male genitalia with more than one tip ( Fig. 7 ,
G. plurilobus
,
sp. n.
, and
G. trilobus
,
sp. n.
)......... 9
- Anophoric process of male genitalia absent or with single tip.................................................. 10

9 Anophoric process with combination of blunt and pointed tips..........................
Guapinannus plurilobus
,
sp. n.

- Anophoric process with multiple pointed tips.........................................
Guapinannus trilobus
,
sp. n.

10 Pygophore with large lobe on right side.............................................
Guapinannus auriculus
,
sp. n.
- Pygophore without or with small lobe on right side.......................................................... 11

13 C+Sc margin very broad, rc about 4 times as long as wide...............................
Guapinannus graziae
,
sp. n.

- C+Sc margin broad, rc about 3 times as long as wide....................................
Guapinannus policis
,
sp. n.

14 Vesica with blunt, expanded tip..................................................
Guapinannus anaticulus
,
sp. n.

15 Anophoric process long and thin, vesica short, about half loop..............................
Guapinannus clava
, sp. n.
- Anophoric process absent or short, vesica longer than half loop................................................ 16

16 Vesica heavy set, with blunt, rounded tip.............................................
Guapinannus robustus
,
sp. n.

17 Vesica close to tip slightly s-shaped................................................
Guapinannus sinuosus
,
sp. n.

18 Anophoric process absent, ~ 1.5 mm body length....................................
Guapinannus castigatus
,
sp. n.

19 Anophoric process short and slender, vesica slender.................................
Guapinannus orbiculatus
,
sp. n.

- Anophoric process short and broad, vesica relatively thick.................................
Guapinannus artus
,
sp. n.
